Susan was easy to reach and responsive to our particular needs.  Definitely recommend and would stay again.  Do pay attention to the description of the drive way - it is steep and a bit of a walk from the road (assuming you do not have 4wheel drive). Thanks Susan!

We had a wonderful stay at Susan's cabin.  We loved the outdoor firepit setup and found everything to be very clean and functional.  It is a great location for exploring the Mt hood area & hiking.  We hope to come back sometime soon
Great little getaway!

This cozy cabin was a perfect stopping point on our trip to rest and enjoy the scenery.
With no internet or cell service, we took it easy and enjoyed the wood burning stove and board games. The comfortable couch was a great spot to enjoy the view out of the massive living room window.

You will never want to leave!  This space is beautiful inside and out. It was thoughtfully designed to accommodate all your needs. The lack of connectivity to Internet is heavenly.  A short drive up 26 you’ll find the best BBQ and cocktails at Skyway.  It is quite a steep driveway to walk up to the cabin, since we don’t have 4WD but 100% worth the effort!!!
Beautiful cabin in a beautiful part of Oregon. Definitely recommend!

This was such a perfect find for us! The cabin was nice and secluded and had such a great view. If it matters to you, there’s no Wi-Fi or really any service at the cabin, but it just lets you enjoy it even more. The town itself is cute and we enjoyed going to Fernies for coffee in the morning.
Simple, yet amazing.

Looking for a cabin getaway tucked away in the mountains close to everything you need, this is the place! Me and my wife truly enjoyed the beautifully crafted space while we are there. Perfect for disconnection to the world to be better connected with nature. We spent our time reading by the wood burning stove and just enjoying time together. Would highly recommend!
Cute cabin, enjoyed my stay!
The cabin was charming and peaceful and beautifully kept.  I stayed for four nights and loved every minute of my stay there!

I will totally be back!
There was next to no cell service (for verizon anyway)- which to me was a MAJOR plus given that I was seeking a retreat, and something that would draw me back as a way to disconnect and unplug.
There was a little bit of road noise from the main road down below, so if you're looking for a ~totally~ quiet woodland experience, this is maybe not the spot for you. But it was perfectly secluded- I could see one neighbor's house from out front but not at all in an intrusive way. And while being so perfectly secluded, it is still 5 minutes away from a well stocked grocery store that sells firewood, and a cute lil Japanese restaurant down the road (koya kitchen!).
I loved this beautiful cabin and the upstairs loft specifically was so cozy and delightful that I found myself missing it when I got home. There is a DVD player with maybe 10 films, so bring a movie!
What an amazing place! We will be coming back!

Very cozy cabin! A little hard to find at first (thanks to Google, Susan's directions were great), but well worth it in the end. A quiet little neighborhood that was close to Mt. Hood and only a short drive from Portland. Excellent location and the cabin itself was comfortable for the two nights we stayed. Highly recommend!
No cell data reception for certain carriers. Bring books. It’s actually nice to get away from your phone screen ;)

This tiny home/cabin had great views! The pictures didn’t do much justice … it was much more alive in real life ! Very cozy and private for a relaxing getaway. Adina and I would recommend this cabin and would definitely come again ! - Will & Adina - FL
Beautiful place to relax, unplug and get away from the busy of life!
We had a great, snowy weekend and loved the cabin! It was a great place to enjoy some outdoor activities on Mt. Hood.
This is such a lovely place to retreat to!!
We had a great stay!

This Cabin get away is wonderful and enchanting. It feels nice and private, good to relax and unwind from the business. Also very convenient to reach hikes and all the fun things Mount Hood has to offer.

Susan’s cabin is a great place to stay and we will definitely be back! The location is wonderful and we had a great time exploring everything Oregon has to offer. Definitely go to the Skyway Bar and Grill down the street, they have great mac and cheese.

One of the cuter AirBnBs I’ve stayed at.
A beautiful secluded tiny home decorated like a cabin (and decorated very well!). Close to Mt Hood skiing and trailheads. Gravel road on the way up was potholey after some heavy rains but nothing even a little sedan couldn’t handle.
Huge windows (with blinds for privacy) and a lovely little wood burning stove = one incredibly relaxing vacation.
What a beautiful little cabin! We had everything we needed inside and out! The views are breathtaking! Relaxation at its finest!
A delightful, tastefully decorated cabin - our night here was so cozy and restful. Just what we needed for a recharge away from the city lights! :)

Great place, warm, cozy and quiet. They’ve packed a lot into this little space. The setting is lovely and feels remote while actually being fairly close to a couple restaurants and the grocery store. Really appreciated that.
And Susan was very helpful and responsive to our questions. That’s always reassuring.
What a great little cabin! Very clean with all the amenities. Great natural light, very private, and quiet. Looking forward to a return visit
Charming cabin. Well designed. Connected to nature and conveniently located to restaurants and Mt recreation.
This place is awesome, perfect for a couple wanting to disconnect from the world and spend quality time together. Thank you also to the wonderful host Susan. We will be back :)
The coziest little cabin tucked away off the highway. We can’t say enough amazing things about our stay here and hope to be back for more weekends away from the city.
loved the stay :) it's a perfect romantic getaway in the woods, where you want to wind out and spend quality time!
Gorgeous, private, deep in the woods—an ideal and special place.
This little cabin is so quaint and was the perfect little adventure get-away for our first wedding anniversary.

What a fabulous stay! We came to celebrate our 28th wedding anniversary. For years I wanted to stay at a cabin in the woods, so when my husband found this little gem I was delighted! We enjoyed our morning coffee by the fire,  afternoon walks around the area and movies in the evening. It’s such a cozy little place and everything I could’ve hoped for. I would definitely like to come back during different seasons. thank you so much for providing such a relaxing, peaceful getaway for people to enjoy, we would definitely recommend
Beautiful location. amazing communication and accommodation from the host. I WILL be returning for more

This was such a dreamy experience! A beautiful place enveloped in an even more beautiful surrounding. Thank you so much for cultivating an environment that provided some much needed r & r.
Cleanliness, communication, and everything else was top notch. Can’t wait to visit again 🌌

A wonderful weekend getaway without having to drive too far into the mountain. I was a little worried when I saw that this was off US-26, but it's completely tucked back in the hillside, so we heard no traffic whatsoever—just birdsongs! (A note on the location: Google Map's live directions couldn't read exactly which road we were on and misled us, so make sure to look at the map as well as the directions. Accidentally drove up someone else's driveway!)
The cabin was cozy. Susan's description of the place and amenities was accurate as well. Not pictured in her photos is a little wood-burning stove, which we used every evening (not necessarily because we needed to—the place had an excellent heater). There are some board games as well! We went on a little hike along Salmon River, then got lunch at Koya Kitchen (delicious soup and sushi!).
It was a nice stay. Do recommend arriving before sunset to the airbnb. It was enjoyable my friend and I had s’mores. It was a nice little cozy place.

My boyfriend and I stayed in this cozy cottage for a yearly snow shoe trip. This little cabin was the perfect place to unwind after long days in the snow. The cabin was clean, remote and has everything you need for a weekend away. We had fires every night and really enjoyed just reading, eating and playing games. We definitely would love to stay here again.
This was such an amazing and cozy little cabin. My fiance and I book this cabin for our snowboarding trip at Mt Hood Meadow. this place was definitely a gem. Will definitely book again in the future.

This cabin is amazing! My fiancé and I stayed for New Years and it was a dream! We love the space provided, especially the loft area where you can wind down and watch some movies. The fire stove was a great addition, really warming up the place and making it feel homey. We definitely plan to come back!

Loved Susan’s beautiful cabin so much! We enjoyed quality time together as a family doing chess and board game together in the night and woke up with beautiful snow scenery from the window! We made lots of memory with this tiny beautiful cabin! Thank you so much!!

Absolutely beautiful. It was a perfect little spot to get away for the night. We watched the snow fall from the big picture window, cozied up under the heavy blankets. We would definitely go again, and highly recommend.

This cabin was a wonderful winter getaway. If you go in the winter, you will need AWD to get up the to parking spot at the bottom of the driveway.
We loved the majestical feeling of being surrounded by the snow in this cozy cabin, with a nice fire!
Bring your own wood/kindling and easy to prepare food because the pans can be sticky, even with oil. We are excited to come back in the spring or summer!
It’s a lovely spot!
Great little quiet place to relax and have a weekend full of adventure
I loved that the pictures really showed the house it was easy to find and a great place to relax.

Loved every second of our 3 night stay. Sipping coffee on the porch, making dinners, exploring the woods out back… rained and snowed, yet the cabin stays warm. The driveway is STEEP so be prepared — but no problem with 4x4 even with a snow dusting!
When you pull onto the road from the main highway, take the first left. Google maps led us straight and to a different house :)

My girlfriend and I spent thanksgiving weekend here and it couldn’t have been a better place to stay. We had outdoor bonfires as well as a couple indoor fires. We loved watching movies in bed at night and waking up and having coffee on the porch. So many cool hikes, restaurants and coffee shops so close by as well as being less then an 1 hour from Hood River and 30 minutes to Sandy. 100% would stay again.

Cute, cozy, and secluded space! Easy check-in. Definitely need 4x4. A little tricky to turn a pickup around. Stopped by the grocery store for some breakfast groceries and snacks! Also took my firestick and used my hotspot for internet! A few restaurants bout 1-2miles from the cabin. It was a nice getaway wkend:)!

This place is cute, cozy, and has a great location for beautiful local hikes. For anyone worried about going up there in the colder months, do not worry about being cold because the heater/AC unit is amazing. We came back from a cold and wet hike and got warmed up in no time thanks to that heater. Lastly, the small and cozy restaurants/cafes in the area have amazing food and atmospheres! Would definitely like to be back in the future!

A thoughtful, simple, beautiful get away space. Every detail is thought out and taken care of, right down to the design of the space. Just what one needs to be still and relax and recenter. I can not recommend this enough for a quiet retreat(though I’d be hesitant to for fear of not being able to book it again myself :) )
Such a beautiful tiny home in the woods!  My husband and I really enjoyed our stay, the location was perfect and the house was so cozy!  Recommend highly!

This place was stunning- I wish we could have stayed for more than one night.  The surroundings were magical, and the space itself was beautifully decorated and super cozy.  We got to build a fire and enjoy the peace and quiet.  Host was quick and responsive, and gave us local recommendations.  I would love to come here again, thanks so much for the stay!

Wow! This place was even better than imagined, the pictures can not capture the magic of this cozy little cabin. Everything about it was absolutely perfect and we look forward to coming back every chance we get!
Cozy, peaceful, restful
A comfy cozy beautiful mountain forest getaway.

Such a beautiful and secluded little cabin! I had so much fun enjoying a night to myself. I spent HOURS wandering around behind the cabin foraging for mushrooms and enjoying the sounds of the forest. The hill to get up to the cabin is definitely steep so the 4WD is 100% necessary. But if you don’t have that, there’s parking at the bottom and you can walk up (it’s a very short distance). The stairs to the loft are also very steep (more of a ladder) so if you’re uncomfortable with your balance and coordination, the couch downstairs is quite comfy and has a fur blanket! I loved it and will definitely be back.
This cabin is perfect to just away from it all. Super cozy and, when the weather is rainy, the atmosphere is amazing. Highly recommend for anyone wanting to relax from the hustle and bustle of life 🤗

I booked this place for a birthday trip, and it was perfect.
The vibrance and lushness of the surrounding nature, the sound of rain on the metal roof, and the cozy design made this a perfect destination for fall in Oregon.
It is was a great distance from a variety of grocery stores, hikes, and activities, and the cabin boasts a very functional design.
When we weren't out and about, the cabin was perfect for getting warm, napping, reading, watching movies, playing games, and cooking.
I highly recommend this stay.
Beautiful, charming cabin right up in the forest. Exquisitely decorated, charming and a lovely place to stay for exploring the area.

We were there for 3 days and nights and it rained almost the entire time... our stay was FANTASTIC! The front porch was covered and a great place to sit and watch the rain fall in the woods. The best part was falling asleep hearing the rain on the metal roof. We did manage to have a couple of fires in the awesome firepit and even managed dinner on it once. What a lovely little cabin in a private woodsy setting! Susan is a great host and decorated the cabin perfectly. Already planning our next visit and how to make it a biannual event! (Truths: 4x4 needed, ladder to loft, you got this... if you're lucky you might get a visit from Big Boss Cat/Kitty.)

Absolutely incredible place, seriously. The photos don't do this little place justice. It sits atop a steep climb behind the owners property, entirely private with great views of the forest around it, and the hillside across the valley. A 15 minute drives gets you to the base of Mount Hood with several options for hiking and sightseeing. The food options around are fantastic and the grocery store down the road is incredibly well stocked for a mountain town. We will definitely be back!

This cabin is exactly what you see in the photos but even better! Perfect for a two person getaway. Well organized and very clean. Great location for restaurants and hiking/lake activities near MT Hood. We will be back!
Cozy little getaway cabin. Beautiful setting. Everything you need for a fun weekend away.

This little spot is the PERFECT getaway and break from the throws of every day life. The design of the landscape and cabin is impeccable. It’s pretty close to a lot of restaurants, only 30 mins to Trillium Lake and 1 hour (gorgeous) drive down to Hood River to check out a ton of amazing wineries.
Wish I had more time for my stay! Loved this place would highly recommend!
Great Stay! Highly recommend
Such a beautiful and peaceful little cabin. We enjoyed our stay!

The Little House on the Mountain is a perfect stay for a quiet, romantic and secluded getaway. Susan is an amazing host and has everything ready and waiting for you to enjoy. I couldn’t have found a better place to celebrate my partner’s birthday.
Tip: turn out every light on the premises and go outside and stare at the stars. Breathtaking!
This cabin is so peaceful and cozy! It is the perfect for any type of getaway. I highly suggest it!

Really thoughtfully designed space that makes you feel comfortable and cosy inside yet very close to the trees and plants you are surrounded by outside.  Great base for hiking along the Salmon River and exploring the area.

Amazing place to get away from it all in the Zigzag area! Comfort all around, inside and out. Our favorite part was the bigger-than-the couch window that gave us a view of the trees and ferns. Susan is a great host, and the little house up the hill is a great spot to enjoy staying inside or exploring all that the area has to offer.
Lovely private cabin, well decorated and comfortable in every way. Driveway is no joke!
The perfect cabin in the woods!  Clean, well equipped, quiet, close to so many great hikes!  I would recommend to anyone looking for a reset!
Great place and location. Serene and peaceful. Had a great time.
Wish we had stayed here longer!! Beautifully decorated, great location!
Enchanting stay, perfect location to Mt Hood. This is a cute, quaint cabin that we enjoyed. Perfect for couples or anyone looking to get outdoors, we will definitely be coming back.

Adorable cabin. Even Better than the pictures. Outdoor space was amazing. Windows look out onto beautiful northwest forest. Basic condiments were provided in the fridge. Washer dryer was an awesome amenity. Cell service is super spotty. No WiFi. Steep hill to get up to cabin. All of which are very clearly stated by host. There is a TV upstairs with a DVD player and a few DVDs. Highly suggest to bring DVDs with you if you plan to stay more than a night or two.
All in all, the cabin exceeded expectations and was a beautiful place to stay.
The little cabin near Mt. Hood was amazing!!! Highly, highly recommend for a short getaway. Perfect access to Mt. Hood trails and Portland.

A nice private escape while still being close enough to explore lakes and Timberline lodge. Be prepared to carry your things up the driveway, but otherwise very quiet, peaceful, and a nice weekend escape.
Super cozy and well decorated.

Great place - the road is definitely steep and I wouldn’t want to drag my bag up there. Otherwise it was lovely, a bit of road noise, but the place is such a nice easy escape and it was incredibly clean. One thing to note - the range is just a cooktop so plan accordingly! Would def recommend for a couple!

I stayed a whole week and didn't think the solitude here is
worth the inconvenience associated with the driveway, the lack of connectivity, and the ladder to/from the bedroom. The driveway is not only a pain when loading/unloading if you don't have 4WD; it's steep and gravel covered and I found it difficult just to walk the 100 yards of it not even carrying much. The place is very isolated visually, completely surrounded by trees and vegetation, which is really nice. However, it's fewer than two tenths of a mile from the highway as the crow flies, so outside the house, there is often a lot of noise from this very busy road. (Inside the house it's quiet.)
While it might be romantic to be "off the grid," it can be difficult to plan activities from the house because you can't reach a map server to find how far away things are and how to get to them. Although absolutely nothing went wrong for me while there, you can't text the owner from the house because there's no service. And regardless of how old you are or what kind of shape you're in, getting up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom is uncomfortable due to the steep climb up and down the bedroom ladder. The
washer/dryer was really nice. There is nothing the owner can do about the steep climb to the bedroom because the place is small; however, the driveway could be improved and a wifi scan at the house revealed several nearby networks so I think connectivity could be improved too.
The cabin is simply amazing.  It was very close to hiking trails and had everything needed for a comfortable stay!
This little cabin is the perfect escape. It’s super easy to get to from PDX, but it feels like your miles away from anything.  Couldn’t ask for a better location for a weekend away!

My husband and I stayed here for one night of our honeymoon road trip. This hidden gem is absolutely gorgeous. It was so nice being “off the grid”. The decor and scenery were amazing and the kitchen is equipped with all the essentials for an “at home” dining experience. We definitely would love to stay here again if we’re ever in the area.

Great location! The views to die for, quiet serenity, surrounded by nature, & perfect for romantic weekend with significant other. Highly suggest 4 wheel drive if you don’t want to walk up and down drive way (if you don’t have 4 wheel drive). We didn’t think it was too bad but if you have a lot of luggage and don’t have great balance you may not want to have to walk up the gravel driveway. Close hiking trails which was major perk.

This incredible gem in the Mt. Hood National Forest is half cabin, half thoughtfully-designed tiny home. It’s perfect for any Portlander needing to get away for a couple of nights. Only 2 minutes off the main highway, but once you arrive it feels like you’re in a little clearing deep in the forest. Susan has thought of everything one could possibly need and her hospitality was lovely. I’ll never forget what it felt like to be here and it’s inspired me to create a place like this someday.

This place was great! Very quiet and private. We met the neighbor’s little dog after it chased our truck up the driveway lol. The neighbor quickly got his dog and apologized. They were both very friendly so no worries.
The driveway was very steep and even a little challenging in our AWD truck but we managed to get up and down just fine. I suggest getting everything you need (food, wood, water, etc.) before you arrive to minimize your trips up and down the driveway. The dollar store down the road had the best prices.
The only issues we had were getting the door to lock and no phone service. The phone service wasn’t an issue besides not being able to communicate about the door issue or check in. I suggest you plan out your daily activities and find restaurants/hiking trails you want to go to before you get there because it will be more challenging to do without service.
Overall great trip! Fire pit was great! I would definitely recommend. My girlfriend and I loved it.

Great little cabin in the woods! Felt much more isolated than other cabins we've visited in Rhododendron. Comfy bed and living space with well appointed kitchen. We recommend getting Skyway BBQ at least once. Loved the big boss cat!

Really a unique stay. The mini cabin is secluded above the owners back part of their property. Sweet big windows,  that make you feel immersed in the ferns and forest. The wood stove, and sitting area inside are perfectly quaint. Everything is there you need inside to be comfortable. Outside I think is the best. The fire pit area and little porch are perfectly nestled amongst the trees and outdoor landscape. Overall a great little stay. Do note: Drive way up to the cabin is steep! Head the warning in good or bad weather. Enjoy!

We absolutely loved staying at this cabin. Beautiful in and out, clean, and plenty of hot water from the shower. I was especially impressed with the artistic style throughout (cutest artwork ever) and the big, beautiful trees outside. My husband enjoyed fireside smores and wished we had booked longer than just 2 days. Thank you for all your efforts Susan!

Absolutely adorable cabin in a very private and cozy location. If you like critters like my husband and I do, you’ll be happy to know there are salamanders all around the property at night. The decor was great and the washer/dryer was an absolute perfect addition!
Susan was a great host and her home was beautiful. If I were blessed with another opportunity to stay at Susan’s cabin, I would 100%
Beautiful cabin, small ski town close to the location.We spent the weekend kayaking and fishing.
What a very cute place with a great fire pit. Amazing location! I recommend bringing your own pillows as the ones on the bed are very small.
great place lots to do in the local area, and lots of privacy
We loved this tiny house! Private and beautiful and fabulous all around.

By far the most magical place I’ve ever stayed! It feels so private while being so close to the great restaurants and shops. Every detail is thought out and the house is so well made. I haven’t felt this peaceful in awhile. I can’t wait to return.

Susan's cabin is a wonderful retreat. It took us away from the hustle and bustle of our home lives to a space that felt carefree. It was cozy, comfortable without the usual life's conveniences, like cable TV and wi-fi, we enjoyed the opportunity to disconnect.
The cabin was immaculate and located in such a beautiful + serene place. I'd stay here forever if I could!
GREAT place. A great romantic getaway. Bed is super comfortable! Stores and restaurant nearby. Just the perfect place in the heart of the Forrest.
Great spot, just what we needed. I was showing some family around that flew in from Boston. This was a great place to stay so they could see MT Hood.

We loved this space, so cozy in the woods. Option to have a fire inside or outside and loved reading our books outside in the Adirondack chairs. Super clean and comfortable with lots of great hikes nearby and gorgeous sky at night. Be aware that the hot water runs out quickly so if you have two people showering, go fast! Would totally stay here again.
It was so detailed, they had everything you needed for the stay. Definitely a good place to visit!
Great lil cabin for a getaway we had a really nice night there and super cozy I’d recommend to anyone

This was the perfect little getaway to relax and unwind after exploring the area’s natural wonders. If possible, this little cabin is even better than it appears. We chopped wood to fuel the wood-burning stove, took in the lush surroundings, & enjoyed the serenity. Everything we could want and more, would highly recommend!!

Straight out of a fairytale. Walking up the steep driveway slightly and just a tad out of breathe we both managed to say “ wow”
This little cabin was EXACTLY what we needed after three days of camping.
It seems as though every nook and cranny was used to its utmost advantage. It has everything you could need. Decor was spot on and the panoramic views from the inside looking out was serene.
The fireplace outside was our go to, we just sat and and enjoyed the present time truly feeling like we were in some sort of alternate moss and forest infused universe.
Twas a perfect ending to our adventure.
P.s.
Try the bbq place right across the street!

This cabin was the perfect weekend getaway! We especially loved the location deep in the woods. There is a huge window behind the couch that makes you feel like you are lounging in the wilderness. The cabin feels brand new and has everything you need. The fire pit was a bonus!
Wish we were able to stay longer, incredible! Thank you.
Susan's cabin is fantastic! My husband and I absolutely loved spending time there. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a cozy vacation!
Such a sweet gem! I enjoyed my stay very much and the cabin is exactly as described!
A wonderful. peaceful, relaxing stay!
Enjoyed a wonderful stay in the little cabin in the woods! Amazing location that makes it the perfect spot for relaxation and reflection!
Cozy little cabin surrounded by a huge forest, really good for a relaxing getaway. Plus somebody’s cat wandered up to say hi to us so that was an extra positive!
This cabin was awesome!  Very secluded, as well as one of the cleanest places I have stayed.
Amazing cabin so cozy and beautiful!!!

Private, comfortable, and very clean. Everything we needed for a relaxing couple of nights. We stayed warm, slept soundly, and ate well (groceries from Thriftway, BBQ from Skyway). We enjoyed hiking the Salmon River Trail. And when the clouds parted for a moment one night, the view of the stars from the front porch was incredible.
Tech notes: The steep driveway is no joke. We would not have managed it without AWD. Our cell signal (Sprint) was zero to weak -- slightly better outside than in.

Had a great relaxing cozy time. The wood stove and all the cabin decor was so cute. We stayed 4 nights and didn’t want to leave. The view from the cabin was amazing. It was close to Mt.Hood and lots of hiking or snowshoeing around.
Wonderful place to stay! Even cuter than the pictures.
Unique stay, with thoughtful touches. Between deer antlers, cool sofa throws and unique wall decor it really felt like a “cabin in the woods”. Highly recommend, had a great time.

The place was really nice and cozy.  Unfortunately, the power went out during our last night there and was out through the morning & checkout.  We messaged the host a heads up and some questions, and we didn’t hear back.  Had this not happened I would have given the place 5 stars, but it did.
The location was great it’s very private and quite. We will definitely stay again.
Love this place - contemporary, cozy, and super clean.
Great place and very peaceful. If your going in the winter bring a shovel with you and bring snow pants and snow boots as well
Great place and communication!
Would recommend staying here. Had a great time, the amenities were very nice and the check in process was easy.

We loved this place! It has everything you’d need but nothing more than you’d want. Nice and cozy for the perfect little get away. Fire place does great and keeping the loft warm and is nice and relaxing too!
Great mountain getaway. Very cozy love the big window!

Cozy cabin in a peaceful setting, nestled in the woods for a getaway from the hustle and bustle of life. The space is well thought out and stylishly appointed. We loved the wood burning stove in the cabin - kept us warm and cozy throughout our stay. Everything was perfect and we are already looking forward to our next getaway to the little house on the mountain!

This is a sweet, private cabin that is perfect for an unplugged weekend. Close to the slopes, across the road from some great BBQ, and tucked in the trees, this is an ideal location for your stay on Mt. Hood.
Very cozy cabin with tasteful decoration and upscale amenities. We loved all the extra little touches that made our stay in the pretty Mt. Hood woods excellent!
This place is very cozy and cute! You can tell a lot of thought went into each detail. Perfect for a getaway whether you just want to recharge or have a fun time at the mountain! We loved it
Cozy and clean, perfect for some good old fashioned quality time with a loved one.
The cutest mountain cabin. Clean and cozy!

Nestled in the forest atop a little hill, this cabin was the perfect holiday getaway. The space is thoughtfully designed with everything you’d need to “power off” — board games, DVDs, candles, coffee and full kitchen amenities. There’s a fire pit too— we couldn’t take advantage due to rain but it had all the makings for a lovely evening under the stars.
Given the state of things in 2020, I especially appreciated how meticulously clean the cabin was when we arrived. I’d definitely recommend a stay here!

Nestled at the top of the neighborhood hill, sits this pristine transportation device that takes you to another world. The warmth and vibe of this place were exceptional for decompressing and sparking some inspiration. The place was very clean and had all you need to enjoy some peace and tranquility. Really loved the fox paintings! I plan to visit again and hope to own a place like this someday!

My husband and I usually have an annual family vacation, this year it was cancelled due to covid. We ended up planning to go up the mountain and in the midst of planning that I found myself looking at this cabin, we booked it and it was the best little getaway ever! Totally worth it.

This little cabin is awesome. The location is great and provides easy access to Mt. Hood. It is warm and cozy, and the wood burning oven in the living room is a huge plus. You definitely need an AWD/4WD car to get up the driveway, but that’s not a big deal at all. Overall great stay, and we will definitely be back!
We had a lovely stay at Susan's sweet cabin. Very private, cozy and quiet.  Nice artistic touches. Beautiful forested and mountain views from the big windows.

A rare gem nestled in a woodsy neighborhood near Mt Hood. A charming and cozy tiny home that was stunning inside and out. One of the few places that looks even better than in the photos. While  our stay was part of our eighth mother-daughter trip, this is perfect for bringing significant others. And, it’s so close to all the Mt Hood area offers!
This cabin is a perfect getaway for two!  Clean and tidy with thoughtful design and amenities. We will definitely be back!
Cozy and nicely decorated place to stay in convenient location for great hikes...also, very responsive host!

This place is amazing! Such a sweet nicely decorated and cozy little cabin nestled in the woods. Very private feeling. The forest behind the cabin is wonderful for exploring. This is a sweet spot for a romantic getaway 💚

What a gem! This cabin was so cute and cozy. It was a perfect little getaway. There were so many personal touches that you don’t usually come across in an AirBnB. I’d recommend this cabin to anyone looking for a getaway near Mt. Hood.
We had a lovely stay. The space was perfect and felt special. Susan was helpful and attentive.
Perfect little peaceful space nestled in the woods just big enough for me, mySelf and I 😊

We absolutely LOVED it here! It was so cozy, and the perfect little getaway. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay - just make sure you have an AWD 4-wheel drive car because it is a steep driveway!
